title: Unipetrol selects Technip to provide services for polyethylene unit in Czech
text:
Unipetrol selects Technip to provide services for polyethylene unit in Czech 14 September 2015 Print Email 
Czech petrochemical group Unipetrol has awarded a €213m contract to Technip Italy to provide engineering and construction services for a new polyethylene unit (PE3) at its Litvinov plant. 
The project is estimated to cost CZK8.5bn ($352m), considered to be the largest investment in the history of theCzech petrochemical industry. 
The facility, which is expected to come into operation by the mid 2018, will produce high density polyethylene (HDPE). It will replace the PE1 unit. " The technology will move Unipetrol to the European elite in the area of product quality, and at the same time ensure even better safety and reliability of the production." 
Said to be one of the advanced units in Europe, the PE3 will feature natural and black line, and will have a production capacity of 270,000t a year. 
Ineos has licensed the production process and technology for PE3, as part of an agreement signed in October 2013. 
Unipetrol CEO and chairman Marek Switajewski said: "The construction of the new polyethylene unit is a key investment not only within our mid-term strategy but also for the development of the Czech petrochemical industry, both because of the capital invested and the most advanced technology to be used. 
"The technology will move Unipetrol to the European elite in the area of product quality, and at the same time ensure even better safety and reliability of the production. 
"This is also a clear indication of our long-term commitment to the strategic development on the Czech market." 
Unipetrol currently produces 320,000t a year of HDPE. The PE3 will increase the production capacity to 470,000t a year. 
Work on the project will commence in the second quarter of 2016, and will support the region with around 1,000 jobs. 
Source:http://www.unipetrol.cz/en/media/pressreleases/Pages/new-polyethylene-unit.aspx 
Contract on construction of the new polyethylene unit with Technip Italy SpA 
UNIPETROL, a.s. ("Unipetrol") informs that today UNIPETROL RPA, s.r.o., 100% owned subsidiary of Unipetrol, signed an EPC (engineering, procurement and construction) contract with Technip Italy S.p.A. ("Technip") on construction of the new polyethylene unit (PE3) at Litvínov plant.New polyethylene unit (PE3) will be producing high density polyethylene (HDPE) which is also produced by current two polyethylene units in operation. Production process and technology for PE3 unit will be based on the license agreement signed with INEOS in October 2013. PE3 unit will be among the most advanced units of this type in Europe. Its construction is the key investment project within Unipetrol Group Strategy 2013-2017 announced in June 2013. Strategy specified that petrochemical business will be the key profit maker of Unipetrol Group in the mid-term horizon and this strategic rationale has been already confirmed by the development during last two years since the publication of the Strategy.Total contract price is EUR 213 million (CZK 5.76 billion). Total CAPEX for the whole PE3 unit project including the already purchased license and works to be performed by other contractors will be approximately CZK 8.5 billion, i.e. it is the biggest investment in the history of the Czech petrochemical industry.PE3 unit will consist of two lines, natural line with production capacity of 270 kt per year and black line with production capacity of 100 kt per year. Total production capacity of the unit will be 270 kt per year, i.e. if black line is utilized on 100% natural line will produce maximally 170 kt per year.Unipetrol's production capacity of high density polyethylene (HDPE) is currently 320 kt per year, i.e. polyethylene unit 1 (PE1) - 120 kt per year, and polyethylene unit 2 (PE2) - 200 kt per year. PE3 unit will replace PE1 unit. Therefore Unipetrol's production capacity will increase to 470 kt per year (PE2 & PE3).PE3 unit will enable a higher utilization of the steam cracker unit producing ethylene which is further processed on polyethylene units and will also contribute to higher integration of Unipetrol Group's refining and petrochemical production. PE3 unit is expected to bring a significant positive impact on Unipetrol's Group profitability as well. Moreover the most advanced technology will increase safety and reliability of the production.Investment into PE3 unit reacts on the world trend of declining demand for basic ethylene and on the other hand increasing demand for high density polyethylene (HDPE). New unit will enable production of the most advanced types of polyethylene for which there is a high demand on the European market. Thanks to the new technology Unipetrol will be able to target other industrial segments such as cosmetic or packaging.At the moment companies Metrostav and CKD Praha DIZ are already present on the site at Litvínov plant performing all preparatory works needed for the construction of PE3 unit itself. Technip will start construction works during second quarter 2016. End of the construction is planned for the first quarter 2018 and commissioning for mid-2018. Follow Us:
